title: Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation Protections
description: Strategic Lawsuit Against Public Participation Protections

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Senate/ received bill from Legislative Research in Waiting for Introduction in the Senate

general_provisions: This bill modifies the Uniform Public Expression Protection Act.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>modifies the scope of the Uniform Public Expression Protection Act (act) to apply only to causes of action for defamation or slander in relation to a claim involving exercise of a constitutional right;<hr><ltbullet>permits a party to issue a subpoena for testimony at a hearing conducted pursuant to the act, with some limitations;<hr><ltbullet>requires that a cause of action be dismissed without prejudice instead of with prejudice in some circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>removes the ability to seek costs, attorney fees, and expenses in some circumstances;<hr><ltbullet>modifies provisions addressing attorney fees and the precedential effects of a voluntary dismissal of a cause of action;<hr><ltbullet>provides that trial proceedings on discovery and certain causes of action are not stayed while an appeal is pending; <hr><ltbullet>modifies standards required to obtain a reward of costs, attorney fees, and expenses in some circumstances; and<hr><ltbullet>modifies language related to broadly construing the purpose of the act.
last_action: Senate/ received bill from Legislative Research
last_action_owner: Waiting for Introduction in the Senate
